section1.title: You should know...
section1.text: That the GLORIA project is still at an early stage of development. We are a small and multidisciplinary team (astronomers, computer scientists, physicists ...) with a huge illusion that all our ideas come true.

section2.title: Our goal
section2.text: We want GLORIA to become the tool of choice for learning and research in astronomy. It is an ambitious goal and we know that there is a long road ahead. Our first milestone is to provide a set of experiments so you can test our telescopes and help researches with image analysis.

section3.title: What can you do?
section3.paragraph1: The basic tool for learning and research is the experiment. In GLORIA we have two types of experiments: the ones that serve to take images -online- and the ones that analyze them -offline-.
section3.paragraph2: Currently we offer four different experiments, which will go better with your help. Hope you enjoy.

solar.title: Solar experiment
solar.desc: Explore the Sun and its spots. Take images to help the measurement of solar activity.

night.title: Night experiment
night.desc: Watch the night sky. Stars, galaxies and asteroids await.

pspace.title: Personal space
pspace.desc: Take an event to locate the region of the sky that was directly overhead at that exact moment.

wolf.title: Solar activity
wolf.desc: Analyze sunspots on your Android and contribute to the measurement of solar activity.
